result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Preston Donnell Allen Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Preston Donnell Allen Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sarah Zwach appeared by video for Preston Donnell Allen Jr.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty on behalf of Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond and Status of Counsel hearing. Attorney Zwach was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion for Bail Reduction or Modification. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
DEFENSE NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR BAIL REDUCTION OR MODIFICATION; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
received and filed.
received and filed.

Defendant Preston Donnell Allen Jr in Court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in Court for Preston Donnell Allen Jr.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Court reviewed Motion to Withdraw. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of conflict within the Public Defender's Office. Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Withdraw. Attorney Sarah Zwach, present in Court, agreed to take case. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. Court VACATED Jury Trial date. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am. Hearing will be held via ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Preston D. Allen, Jr. - #2022002819, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statement.  (Preston D. Allen, Jr. - #2022002819, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL FOR DEFENDANT; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Court will address Motion at the hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022.

Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status Hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense counsel received discovery material and offer from the State. Defense advised the Court of possible resolution. Defense counsel requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 1:30 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Jury Trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in Court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of Defendant's inability to view all discovery material. Defense requested to address bail. State to comply with Victim Notification. Case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing, Branch 46. Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:50 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in Court, Defendant Preston Donnell Allen not in Court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Defense requested discovery material from the State. Court ordered Defense and State to meet/talk at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:45 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of defendants pending matters regarding case 21CF2616, 21CF205, and defendant's prior conviction regarding case 11CF39748. Sworn for the State: P.O. Rodolfo Ayala - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense request to be heard as to bail. Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen

Defendant Preston Donnell Allen not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with AMG, dob 8/18/90 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preston Donnell Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
